required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Differences Between of Uni-portal and Three Port Video-assisted Thoracoscopic Surgery on Perioperative Clinical Indexes、Inflammatory Reaction and Quality of Life Scores of Patients With Non-small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Differences Between of Uni-portal and Three Port Video-assisted Thoracoscopic Surgery on Perioperative Outcomes and Quality of Life Scores of Patients With Non-small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: During the last fifteen years, the investigator have seen a substantial change of course in the scenario of thoracic surgery. The minimally invasive video-assisted surgical approach has spread in a gradually wider and more rapid way, being nowadays the treatment of choice for many thoracic disease traditionally managed by open surgery. The study is to observe and compare the effects of two kinds of pulmonary lobectomy on perioperative clinical indexes、inflammatory reaction and quality of life scores of patients with non-small cell lung cancer

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the surgery
primary_outcome.description: record intraoperative hemorrhage volume at the end of the surgery
record chest drainage time until remove drainage tube

primary_outcome.measure: duration of the healing of incision
primary_outcome.description: record the duration of the healing of incision

primary_outcome.measure: out-of-bed activity time (Day) and length of hospital stay (Day)
primary_outcome.description: record the days of patients' out-of-bed activity time and length of hospital stay after surgery
record postoperative pain 24 hours after surgery by using visual analog scale (VAS) score, where 0 indicates painlessness, and 10 indicates severe pain
record postoperative adverse effects 24 hours after surgery

intervention.description: patients received pulmonary lobectomy under general anesthesia by using uni-portal VATS method
patients received pulmonary lobectomy under under general anesthesia by using three port VATS method
